H0.text: Felsic magmas are viscous magmas that are high in silica and tend to stay below the surface or erupt explosively.

H1.text: Sedimentary magmas are viscous magmas that are high in silica and tend to stay below the surface or erupt explosively.

H2.text: Compacted magmas are viscous magmas that are high in silica and tend to stay below the surface or erupt explosively.

H3.text: Combustible magmas are viscous magmas that are high in silica and tend to stay below the surface or erupt explosively.

A4.text: Molten felsic magma and lava is more viscous than molten mafic magma and lava.

A5.text: Felsic refers to silicate minerals, magma, and rocks which are enriched in the lighter elements such as silicon, oxygen, aluminium, sodium, and potassium.
